news_header: A motorist in Munich drove into a crowd, injuring at least 28 people, with two in serious condition. The driver, a 24-year-old Afghan asylum seeker, has been apprehended.
news_original_title: Ainakin 28 on loukkaantunut Münchenin autoiskussa – Scholz: epäillyn lähdettävä maasta
news_text: Initial reports suggested a fatality, but this was later retracted. The incident occurred during a demonstration and may have involved gunshots. Authorities are investigating, and the case has been transferred to the Central Bureau of the Bavarian Public Prosecutor's Office. There is currently no evidence linking the incident to an upcoming security conference in Munich.
